summary: The "Improving Menopause Care for Veterans Act of 2025" directs the Comptroller General to conduct a study on menopause, perimenopause, and related care furnished by the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA). Within 18 months, a public report is required, evaluating current care, provider training, patient access, educational outreach, and care quality. The report must offer recommendations for improvement. Following this, the VA Secretary has six months to submit a strategic plan to Congress on how to implement the recommendations and enhance menopause care access and quality for veterans.
